sorular.soru: What should you do if this light is on?
cevaplar: Stop as soon as possible and call the breakdown service.
Stop as soon as possible and fasten your seat belt.
Keep driving and fasten your seat belt.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop as soon as possible and fasten your seat belt.

feedback.metin: If this light is on, it means that the seat belt is not being worn. Stop as soon as possible at the side of the road and put it on. Do not do this while driving; this can be dangerous.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: The cycle path is so far away from the roundabout that it is no longer a component of the roundabout. That means that this has become a regular intersection. In this case, the cyclist also has the B-6 sign (give way to drivers on the intersecting road) and priority triangles. The cyclist must therefore give way to you.

sorular.soru: In addition to the fuel consumption, what can also be found on the energy label?
cevaplar: CO2 emissions and motor vehicle tax rate.
Motor vehicle tax rate and fuel type.

feedback.metin: On the energy label, you will find the type of fuel, the CO2 emissions and the type of passenger car. It does not state the rate at which the vehicle is subject to motor vehicle tax. You can find this on the website of the tax authorities.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?

feedback.metin: When a police vehicle approaches you from behind on a roundabout while using optical and sound signals, you should drive around the roundabout again. This gives the police a chance to take the right turn as quickly as possible, so that you are no longer in front of them. This is safer than swerving.

sorular.soru: What speed difference, relative to the snorfietser, should you take into account?

feedback.metin: Snorfietsen can travel at a maximum of 25 km/h. As the driver of a passenger car, you can drive at a maximum of 50 km/h in built up areas. The speed difference you should take into account is therefore 25 km/h. The 30 km/h signs are for the adjacent road.

sorular.soru: What can you get imposed if you are preparing to drive a vehicle under the influence of alcohol?
cevaplar: Nothing. After all, you are not a driver if you are not driving yet.

feedback.metin: If you are about to drive under the influence of alcohol, or any other substance that affects your driving skills, you may be banned from driving. A driving ban is a ban on driving a vehicle (including a bicycle!) for a certain number of hours. This is imposed to prevent someone from driving (further) under the influence of alcohol. A driving licence suspension can only be imposed if you have actually driven a motor vehicle.

sorular.soru: Which part of the road can also serve as a rush hour lane?

feedback.metin: The rush-hour lane is actually the hard shoulder, which is used as an extra lane during rush hour. When the rush-hour lane is in use, there is no hard shoulder anymore. The signs above and along the road make it clear which lanes are open and also indicate that the rush-hour lane is closed again and serves as a hard shoulder.

sorular.soru: Together, your car with trailer is 9 metres long. Are you allowed to overtake the vehicle in front of you?

feedback.metin: When your car and trailer together is longer than 7 metres, you are only allowed to drive on the two rightmost lanes of the motorway. There are only two lanes open at the moment, so you are allowed to use them both. The hard shoulder is not used as a lane right now and therefore does not count as a lane. You are allowed to overtake the vehicle in front of you. Do keep in mind that your maximum allowed speed is 90 km/h.

sorular.soru: Is the motorcyclist allowed to overtake you?

feedback.metin: The F-1 sign means: motor vehicles overtaking each other is prohibited. A motorist cannot overtake a motorcyclist and vice versa. Also, motorcyclists are not allowed to overtake each other.

sorular.soru: Should you indicate if you want to merge?
cevaplar: Yes, at the beginning of the acceleration lane.
No, this is not required but is preferable.
Yes, just before you start merging.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, just before you start merging.

feedback.metin: If you want to merge, do not indicate until you start to merge. You must never force a merge using your indicator. Merging is a special manoeuvre where you must give way to all traffic on the main carriageway.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with your dipped headlights here?

feedback.metin: It is not mandatory to drive with your dipped headlights when you have a good field of view during the day. However, it is allowed and in general sensible to do so.

sorular.soru: Which tyres carry a higher risk of aquaplaning?

feedback.metin: Aquaplaning occurs when tyre grooves can no longer drain water. With wide tyres, it takes longer for water to drain through the grooves.

sorular.soru: Which element in the picture indicates the road number?

feedback.metin: The road number, in this case, is A16. This stands for motorway number 16. 'Li' stands for the left-hand side of the motorway and 25,2 is the hectometre number. This indicates where you are on the left-hand side of the A16. If you provide emergency services with this information in case of a breakdown or an accident, they will know exactly where you are.

sorular.soru: In which situations are you allowed to park here?
cevaplar: Only with a disabled parking permit.
With a disabled parking permit or a disabled vehicle and a set parking disc.
With a disabled parking permit or a disabled vehicle.
sorular.dogruCevap: With a disabled parking permit or a disabled vehicle.

feedback.metin: Only drivers of a disabled vehicle or another vehicle with a valid disabled person's parking permit may park in disabled parking spaces. The parking permit must be clearly visible in the vehicle. A parking disc must only be used in addition to the disabled person's parking card if the sign or a supplementary plate shows a symbol of a parking disc or a maximum parking duration. The latter is not the case here.

sorular.soru: Is it safe to wait here for help after a breakdown?

feedback.metin: If you have a breakdown and stop on the hard shoulder, stand behind the crash barrier to wait for the breakdown service.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here?

feedback.metin: On autowegen within built-up areas, the speed limit is 50 km/h, unless a higher speed is indicated. With a combination of signs that both indicate a speed limit 'unless otherwise indicated', you should adhere to the lowest speed limit. In this case that is the speed limit of the built-up area, which is 50 km/h. When there is a third sign present, which only states a speed limit, for instance 70 km/h, that speed limit supersedes the speed limits of the other signs. In that case the speed limit would be 70 km/h. But that sign is not present here.

sorular.soru: You want to turn left. Are you pre-sorted correctly here?

feedback.metin: You are not pre-sorted correctly here. You want to turn left on a carriageway without markings. You must pre-sort against the road axis (the imaginary line in the middle of the carriageway). In this case, you are pre-sorted too far to the right.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: The G-9 sign indicates that this is a bridle path. You are not allowed to drive here in a passenger car.

sorular.soru: Does the oncoming lorry driver also have a green light?
cevaplar: Yes. The oncoming lorry driver also has a green light.
No. The oncoming lorry driver has a red light.
Maybe. But you cannot deduce that from this situation.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. The oncoming lorry driver has a red light.

feedback.metin: The green traffic light is arrow-shaped, which means you should not expect oncoming traffic. The oncoming lorry driver, therefore, has a red light.

sorular.soru: Is it possible that your oncoming traffic is blinded by your dimmed headlights when your vehicle is overloaded?

feedback.metin: When a vehicle is heavily loaded, more weight is applied to the rear of the vehicle than the front. As a result, your headlights will no longer be properly adjusted and will cause glare for oncoming traffic. Some vehicles have the possibility to adjust this by using a button on the dashboard.

sorular.soru: Is it sensible to make room for the motorcyclist to overtake between traffic jams?

feedback.metin: Motorcyclists are allowed to drive between cars in slow-moving and stationary traffic jams if the difference in speed does not exceed 10 km/h and if it is done carefully. This is only allowed between the two left lanes. Therefore it is sensible to make room for the motorcyclist as it promotes the traffic flow.

sorular.soru: Until when will the driving licence be extended if you are 67 years old?

feedback.metin: If you renew your driving licence after reaching the age of 65 but have not yet reached the age of 70, your new driving licence is valid until you reach the age of 75. After reaching the age of 70, your driving licence will be renewed for 5 years at a time.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to send a message on your phone?

feedback.metin: This is a lay-by, which you may only use in case of a breakdown or an emergency situation. Using a lay-by as a rest stop, to make a phone call, or to send a message is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Can you pick up a passenger here?

feedback.metin: You may not park or wait on or within 5 metres of a crossing, as this may inconvenience cyclists and pedestrians.

sorular.soru: Is a coach driver allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: This lane may only be used by bus drivers. A coach is also a bus.

sorular.soru: Do pedestrians have right of way in an erf?

feedback.metin: Rules regarding right of way are the same in an erf as those for intersections outside of an erf. This means you are required to give way to all drivers approaching from the right. Pedestrians are not classed as drivers and therefore do not have right of way. Just as at other intersections, you are required to give pedestrians right of way if they are continuing ahead and you want to turn off, or if they are crossing an exit construction you want to drive in or out of. An important difference is that pedestrians in an erf are allowed to use the full width of the carriageway and you as a driver must anticipate children playing.

sorular.soru: Is this sufficient lateral distance?

feedback.metin: Bicycles are balance vehicles just like mopeds, snorfietsen and motorcycles. While riding, they sway somewhat. Therefore, when overtaking, you should always maintain a safe and wide lateral passing distance of at least one to one and a half metres. If this is not possible, it is better to wait before overtaking.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to change lanes?

feedback.metin: You may change lanes at the block marking. Pay attention and take care not to obstruct traffic behind you and traffic on other lanes. However, if you are not at an intersection with pre-sorting lanes for different directions, but a through lane with exit lane, such as on the motorway, you may not re-enter the through lane once there are directional arrows on the exit lane.

sorular.soru: After which sign should you expect no oncoming traffic?

feedback.metin: Sign C-3 indicates a one-way street that is closed to drivers in the opposite direction. Sign D-4 indicates an obligation to drive straight ahead at the intersection but does not indicate that it is a one-way street. This is where you should expect oncoming traffic.

sorular.soru: What should you do if your vehicle ends up in the soft verge?
cevaplar: Maintain speed and turn back onto the road immediately.
Release the accelerator and turn back onto the road at a low speed.
Brake forcefully and turn back onto the road at a low speed.
sorular.dogruCevap: Release the accelerator and turn back onto the road at a low speed.

feedback.metin: If your vehicle ends up on a soft verge, release the accelerator and wait until you reach a very low speed before turning back onto the road. If you brake forcefully or turn back onto the road at high speed, you will skid across the road.

sorular.soru: How many metres may an indivisible load protrude at the front of a trailer?
cevaplar: No load may protrude from the front of the trailer.
A maximum of half the length of the trailer.
sorular.dogruCevap: No load may protrude from the front of the trailer.

feedback.metin: No load at all may protrude from the front of a trailer, not even an indivisible load. For passenger cars this is allowed for a maximum of 1 metre.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to turn around here?

feedback.metin: This road has separate carriageways and a wide central reservation. You are only allowed to enter the street on the right-hand side of the central reservation. The other side of the central reservation is for oncoming traffic, which also means you cannot turn here. To leave the road on this side you have to drive around the central reservation.

sorular.soru: Are you pre-sorted correctly here?

feedback.metin: You may never use a bicycle lane marked with a solid line to get into the right lane. So you are not pre-sorted properly here.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the cars in the left lane on the right here?
cevaplar: Only if other drivers keep to the left unnecessarily.
Yes, overtaking on the right is allowed in this situation.
No, overtaking on the right is prohibited here.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, overtaking on the right is prohibited here.

feedback.metin: Overtaking the cars in the left lane on the right is prohibited. You must overtake on the left, and hindering or endangering other road users is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to turn off the dipped headlights when using the front fog lights?
cevaplar: Yes. You can always replace dipped headlights with fog lights.
Yes. But only if there is poor visibility due to fog.
No. Dipped headlights must always be on when fog lights are in use.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. But only if there is poor visibility due to fog.

feedback.metin: If visibility is poor due to fog, you may use front fog lights. You do not have to use dipped headlights at that time, because dipped headlights can be blinding in very dense fog. However, you should always provide rear lighting, so you should at least provide side light at the same time as the fog light.

sorular.soru: Are motorcyclists with sidecar allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: This road is closed to motorcycles, including motorcycles with sidecars. This road may be used by, for example, passenger cars, lorries, bicycles, and mopeds. Persons pushing a motorcycle on foot are also exempt from this closure, as they are classed as pedestrians.

sorular.soru: What is dangerous about driving like this?
cevaplar: The child may be thrown out of the seat in the event of a collision.
The airbag may hit the child in the event of a collision.
The child may loosen the seat belt themselves.
sorular.dogruCevap: The child may be thrown out of the seat in the event of a collision.

feedback.metin: The childâ€™s seat belt is too loose, partly due to the winter coat. Always place children in the vehicle without (thick) winter coats on, as these prevent the seat belt from doing its job. In this case, the child could be thrown from the seat in the event of a head-on collision, significantly increasing the risk of fatal injury.
